messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Negative spin on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well that number would ve probably been more like 90% ten years ago so it s not so bad. It s kind of dangerous to go to school (shooting-wise) but more
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/15/05 3:17:36 PM, anoletx@... writes:


> The numbers are pretty pathetic now showing 60% believe public
> schooling is better than homeschooling.
>

Well that number would've probably been more like 90% ten years ago so it's
not so bad.

It's kind of dangerous to go to school (shooting-wise) but more dangerous to
be a Christian homeschooler in the southern U.S., it seems, statistically.
Safest: Unschooling. <g> (As far as I know...)

Sandra



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Negative spin on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: It s 53% that think homeschooling is better than public schooling now. With 36% thinking it s worse. S funny as what you call private schools are called public
messages.messageBody:
It's 53% that think homeschooling is better than public schooling
now. With 36% thinking it's worse.

S'funny as what you call private schools are called public schools
here and what you call public schools are called state schools here.
So if any Brit says they went to public school they mean one that
was fee paying.

BWs Elaine

> Take the 'is homeschooling better than public schooling survey'
at MSNBC:
> http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/6862172/#survey
>
> The numbers are pretty pathetic now showing 60% believe public
> schooling is better than homeschooling.
>
> Kay
>

messages.subject: Negative spin on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: MSNBC s Coast to Coast had a piece on the pros and cons of homeschooling    since the kid who murdered his girlfriend s parents was homeschooled and so was
messages.messageBody:
MSNBC's Coast to Coast had a piece on the pros and cons of
homeschooling since the kid who murdered his girlfriend's parents
was homeschooled and so was she. They also identified themselves as
Christians on their websites.
The one good thing was the promotion of the Family Unschoolers Network
and Unschooling.org. The idiot they found to list the cons was hilarious.

Take the 'is homeschooling better than public schooling survey' at MSNBC:
http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/6862172/#survey

The numbers are pretty pathetic now showing 60% believe public
schooling is better than homeschooling.

Kay
